{"type":"task_assignment","taskId":"4","subject":"Analyze team lifecycle and shutdown","description":"Research the full lifecycle of an agent team from creation to shutdown. Examine:
1. Team creation: TeamCreate tool → creates team dir + task dir
2. Task creation and assignment: TaskCreate → TaskUpdate with owner
3. Agent spawning: Task tool with team_name parameter
4. Agent work cycle: claim task → work → mark completed → go idle → get new task
5. Idle notifications: automatic when agent turn ends
6. Shutdown flow: SendMessage shutdown_request → agent responds with shutdown_response → process terminates
7. Team cleanup: TeamDelete removes both ~/.claude/teams/<team>/ and ~/.claude/tasks/<team>/
8. What Hive does differently: hooks for event capture, persisted messages in messages.ndjson

Also look at Hive's event system in src/events/ to understand how it captures agent team events via hooks.

Look at .hive/drones/demo-smoke-test/ for the Hive-side artifacts (status.json, activity.log, events.ndjson).

Write your findings to /Users/fr162241/Projects/hive/agent-teams-analysis/04-lifecycle.md

Also copy .hive/drones/demo-smoke-test/status.json, events.ndjson, and activity.log to /Users/fr162241/Projects/hive/agent-teams-analysis/raw/drone/","assignedBy":"team-lead","timestamp":"2026-02-09T15:08:18.567Z"}
